Variables

HTreeNode

Node objects are used in a HTreeControl.  Node displays a view, keeps track of its child nodes and handles expanding and collapsing of them.

Summary
HTreeNode
Node objects are used in a HTreeControl.
Static constants
Instance variables
constructor
setContent
Sets the content of this node, an object inherited from HControl.
setHover
Sets the hover status of this node.
isDescendantOf
Returns true when this node is found under _ancestor, at any depth, and false if it doesn’t.
hasChildren
Checks if the tree has child nodes.
addChildNode
Appends the _node into this nodes list of child nodes.
setTree
Updates this node’s and its children’s tree property.
removeChildNode
Removes the given child node from this node.
removeFromParent
Removes this node from its parent.
removeAllChildren
Removes all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.
collapse
Collapses this node, hiding the child nodes.
expand
Expands this node, exposing the child nodes.
collapseAllChildren
Collapses the child nodes of this node, but not this node.
expandAllChildren
Expands the child nodes of this node, but not this node.
toggle
Expand when collapsed, collapse when expanded.
select
Selects the node, setting a CSS class defined in cssSelected to the node’s DOM element indicating the selection status.
deselect
Unselects the node, removing the CSS class defined in cssSelected from the node’s DOM element.
selectAllChildren
Selects all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.
deselectAllChildren
Unselects all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.
draw
The draw method is called by the tree that hosts this node.
drawChildren
Draws all the child nodes of this node.
moveUnder
Completely moves this node (and the child nodes) under the _newParent.
importJSON
Imports a set of structured data into the tree under this node.
mouseUp
This is called through the content object of this node when the item is clicked.
HTreeNodeToggleControl
Small helper class that acts as the expand/collapse toggler on the node.
constructor
mouseDown
Toggles the owner node’s expanded/collapsed status.

Static constants

cssSelectedThe CSS class name of a selected item (“selected”).
cssExpandedThe CSS class name of an item that has subitems and it is expanded (“expanded”).
cssCollapsedThe CSS class name of an item has subitems and it is collapsed (“collapsed”).
cssHoverThe CSS class name to use when an item that may be dropped on this node is hovering above this item (“hovering”).

Instance variables

type’[HTreeNode]’
childNodesAn array of nodes on the tree at the root level.
treeReference to the HTreeControl that currently owns this node.
expandedTrue when the node is expanded, false when it’s collapsed.
selectedTrue when the node is selected, false when it’s not.
toggleControlA reference to a HTreeNodeToggleControl object that handled user interaction for expanding and collapsing nodes.
contentA reference to a content object currently held by this node.  The content object must be derived from HControl.
parentA reference to the parent view of this node.  It’s the parent node of this node too.

Extends

HControl

See also

HTreeControl

constructor

constructor: function(_parentClass,
_content,
_options)

Parameters

_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.  Currently, the _parentClass must always be a valid node or a tree.
_contentThe content object of this node.  Must be derived from HControl.
_optionsSee HControl.constructor and HComponentDefaults

setContent

setContent: function(_content)

Sets the content of this node, an object inherited from HControl.

Parameters

_contentThe new content object of this node.

See also

HControl

setHover

setHover: function(_flag)

Sets the hover status of this node.  When the _flag is true, the content element of this node gets a CSS class attached to it, defined in a static constant cssHover.  When the _flag is false, the CSS class is removed.  This is called automatically by the drag event when the hover status changes.

Parameters

_flagBoolean value of the hover status to be set.

isDescendantOf

isDescendantOf: function(_ancestor)

Returns true when this node is found under _ancestor, at any depth, and false if it doesn’t.

Parameters

_ancestorThe assumed ancestor node of this node.

hasChildren

hasChildren: function()

Checks if the tree has child nodes.

Returns

True if the tree has child nodes and false if it doesn’t.

See also

HTreeNode.hasChildren

addChildNode

addChildNode: function(_node)

Appends the _node into this nodes list of child nodes.

Parameters

_nodeThe node to be added as a child node.

See also

HTreeNode.addChildNode HTreeControl.childNodeAdded

setTree

setTree: function(_tree)

Updates this node’s and its children’s tree property.

Parameters

_treeNew tree of this node, should be an instance of HTreeControl.

removeChildNode

removeChildNode: function(_node)

Removes the given child node from this node.

Parameters

_nodeThe child node to be removed from this node.

See also

HTreeControl.removeChildNode HTreeControl.childNodeRemoved

removeFromParent

removeFromParent: function()

Removes this node from its parent.

See also

removeChildNode HTreeControl.childNodeRemoved

removeAllChildren

removeAllChildren: function()

Removes all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.

See also

HTreeControl.removeAllNodes HTreeControl.childNodeRemoved

collapse

collapse: function()

Collapses this node, hiding the child nodes.

expand

expand: function()

Expands this node, exposing the child nodes.

collapseAllChildren

collapseAllChildren: function()

Collapses the child nodes of this node, but not this node.

See also

HTreeControl.collapseAll

expandAllChildren

expandAllChildren: function()

Expands the child nodes of this node, but not this node.

See also

HTreeControl.expandAll

toggle

toggle: function()

Expand when collapsed, collapse when expanded.

See also

collapse expand

select

select: function(_extendSelection,
_ignoreSelectionChange)

Selects the node, setting a CSS class defined in cssSelected to the node’s DOM element indicating the selection status.

See also

HTreeControl.selectNode HTreeControl.selectionChanged

deselect

deselect: function()

Unselects the node, removing the CSS class defined in cssSelected from the node’s DOM element.

See also

HTreeControl.deselectNode HTreeControl.selectionChanged

selectAllChildren

selectAllChildren: function(_ignoreSelectionChange)

Selects all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.  Selecting all nodes works only when the tree is in multiple selection mode.

Parameters

_ignoreSelectionChangeA boolean that indicates whether the hook method selectionChanged should be called if the selection does change.  This is mostly used by internal methods.

See also

HTreeControl.selectAllNodes HTreeControl.setTreeType HTreeControl.selectionChanged

deselectAllChildren

deselectAllChildren: function()

Unselects all the child nodes of this node, but not this node.

See also

HTreeControl.deselectAllNodes HTreeControl.selectionChanged

draw

draw: function()

The draw method is called by the tree that hosts this node.  Calling this after drawing the tree has no effect.

See also

HView.draw HTreeControl.draw

drawChildren

drawChildren: function()

Draws all the child nodes of this node.  This should be automatically called from the HTML-template when the node itself is drawn.

Returns

The markup of the complete child node hierarchy that was drawn.

See also

HTreeControl.drawChildren

moveUnder

moveUnder: function(_newParent)

Completely moves this node (and the child nodes) under the _newParent.  The node is first removed from its current parent’s views array, and then added to the new parent’s views array, and finally the DOM node is moved under the new parent’s child container.

Parameters

_newParentThe target node that this node is to be moved under.

importJSON

importJSON: function(_data,
_class,
_rect)

Imports a set of structured data into the tree under this node.  See HTreeControl.importJSON for details.

Parameters

_dataArray of data to be imported.
_classThe class of the items to be imported (defaults to HStringView).
_rectA HRect object to be used when creating the content objects.

See also

HTreeControl.importJSON

mouseUp

This is called through the content object of this node when the item is clicked.  Handles selection of nodes.

Parameters

_xThe X coordinate of the point where the mouse button was released.
_yThe Y coordinate of the point where the mouse button was released.

HTreeNodeToggleControl

Small helper class that acts as the expand/collapse toggler on the node.

Extends

HControl

See also

HTreeControl HTreeNode

Summary
constructor
mouseDown
Toggles the owner node’s expanded/collapsed status.

constructor

constructor: function(_parentClass)

Parameters

_parentClassThe tree node that this control is to be inserted in.

mouseDown

Toggles the owner node’s expanded/collapsed status.

Parameters

_xThe X coordinate of the point where the mouse button was clicked.
_yThe Y coordinate of the point where the mouse button was clicked.
Generated by Natural Docs
HTreeControl is a control unit that displays hierarchical data and allows the user to expand and collapse its nodes.

Small helper class that acts as the expand/collapse toggler on the node.
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)
The first two parameters are the same as with HView, but additionally sets the label and events.
Define default setting here.
childNodeAdded: function(_parentNode,
_childNode)
Implemented by derived classes to do whatever they please when a node on the tree gains child nodes.
removeChildNode: function(_node)
Removes a node from the tree.
childNodeRemoved: function(_parentNode,
_childNode)
Implemented by derived classes to do whatever they please when a node on the tree loses child nodes.
removeAllNodes: function()
Removes all nodes from the tree recursively.
collapseAll: function()
Collapse all the nodes on this tree.
expandAll: function()
Expand all the nodes on this tree.
selectNode: function(_node,
_extendSelection,
_ignoreSelectionChange)
Selects the _node.
selectionChanged: function()
Implemented by derived classes to do whatever they please when the selection on the tree changes.
deselectNode: function(_node,
_ignoreSelectionChange)
Deselects _node.
selectAllNodes: function()
Selects all the nodes on this tree.
setTreeType: function(_type)
Sets the tree type whether or not it permits multiple selections.
deselectAllNodes: function(_ignoreSelectionChange)
Deselects all the nodes on this tree.
draw: function()
Initializes the visual representation of the object, should call at least drawRect.
draw: function()
Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.
drawChildren: function()
Draws all the nodes on this tree.
importJSON: function(_data,
_class,
_rect,
_parentNode)
Imports a set of structured data into the tree.
HStringView is a view component that represents a non-editable line of text.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
Node objects are used in a HTreeControl.
